Description: Pottery ostracon: fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel. The fabric is partially grey in section, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and faded remains of four lines of black-painted hieratic text. Most probably a letter.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G.Brunton, 'Matmar' (London, 1948), pp.67 and 72, mentioned only ('among the rubbish from houses in the temple area').
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393590) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393590)
